title: Zahav chef visits Portland; Ned Ludd discontinues brunch
text:
Zahav visits Portland
Michael Solomonov, the chef behind Philadelphia's celebrated Israeli restaurant Zahav, will visit Portland in support of his recent cookbook .
Solomonov, who owns a mini empire of Philadelphia restaurants, including Percy Street Barbecue, Federal Donuts and the recently opened hummusiya Dizengoff, will appear at Powell's City of Books Friday.
Plans are also in the works for a collaborative dinner at Ava Gene's, 3377 S.E. Division St., featuring at least five dishes from the cookbook. For more information, contact the restaurant at 971-229-0571.
For a deeper dive into the Zahav cookbook, including its political implications, this Helen Rosner review is well worth a read.
Bye bye brunchie
Ned Ludd, the wood-fired restaurant at 3925 N.E. Martin Luther King Jr., will discontinue its under-the-radar brunch after service Sunday, Nov. 1, according to a press release.
The pleasing brunch, which typically never had a line, usually involved an interesting coffee cake, good French toast, some smoked trout hash and maybe a mimosa or two. It was a personal favorite.
The restaurant also plans to drop its Pizza Mondays, which will be best remembered for launching the raucous pizza pop-up P.R.E.A.M. Drop by Oct. 26 for a party with special pies and appearances from previous Pizza Monday chefs.
Brunch and pizza nights will still be available for private buyouts. Contact events@elderhall.com for more information.
